div.bibl: Denni Hlasatel, Oct. 18, 1915. FIFTY-TWO SALOONS WERE OPEN

body.p: Assistant chief of Police Schuettler received a report yesterday that fifty-two saloonkeepers disregarded Mayor Thompson's decree and had their places open yesterday....

Among those who were accused of violation of the ordinance were the following Bohemians: [Translators Note: Ten names and offenses-namely, keeping open for from ten to thirty minutes after midnight Saturday, or obscuring vision by curtains in windows--omitted in translation.]
